com.guidewire.util
Class StringSubstitution

java.lang.Object
  com.guidewire.util.StringSubstitution

public class StringSubstitution
extends java.lang.Object

StringSubstitution is a utility for dynamically replacing substrings within a larger source string. It is primarily intended for safely reprocessing message payloads. Substrings are marked by arbitrary string delimiters, and the source string is scanned to find all such substrings. For each substring, the supplied instance of the Exchanger interface is called to provide a replacement. The replacement is inserted into the output in place of the token and the delimiters. For example:

 private class SimpleExchanger implements StringSubstitution.Exchanger {
 public String exchange(String token) {
 assert(token.equals("spot");
 return "fred";
 }
 }
 

 Substitution sub = new Substitution("[", "]", new SimpleExchanger());
 System.out.println(sub.substitute("see [spot] run"));

prints out: 

 see fred run

Note that the start and end delimiters may be any arbitrary strings.

The return string is built up by appending the contents of the source string up to the occurrence of the first start delimiter; if not found, the whole string is appended. The rest of the the string is scanned for the first occurrence of the end delimiter. If not found, the rest of the string is returned (including the start delimiter). If the end delimiter is found, the token is extracted (without delimiters) and supplied to the instance of Exchange. If the instance returns a String, including a zero length string, it is appended to replace both the token and delimiters, and the process repeats starting at the next character after the end of the end delimiter. If the instance returns null, the original token (and delimiters) are appended unchanged in the string.

substitute

public java.lang.String substitute(java.lang.String source)
Perform the substitution.

Parameters:
source - The string to scan for tokens.
Returns:
The string with all tokens substituted. Returns null if the source string is null.
